result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Deft. to Judge regarding bond

09:32 AM Defendant Derrick Dale Rockman in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information received.  NG plea entered on all counts.  Present bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

w/conditions   Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.  Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/AED.    Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.
Defense argues reduction of bond.  Response by State.  Court amends bond to $1500.00 w/same condtions.

Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    PQW received/reviewed by Court. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd.  Arraignment scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
